content:
• Wednesday, November 28, 2018
  • EYPT

    EyePoint Pharma files for $75M mixed shelf offering; shares down 3% after hours

    • EyePoint Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:EYPT) slips 3% after hours on light volume on the heels of its prospectus for a $75M mixed shelf offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 PM
  • CPRX

    FDA OKs Catalyst Pharma's Firdapse for LEMS

    • The FDA approves Catalyst Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:CPRX) Firdapse (amifampridine) for the treatment of Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome (LEMS), a rare autoimmune disorder in which the immune system attacks the connections between nerves and muscles.
    • Previously: Catalyst Pharma perks up ahead of FDA action on Firdapse for LEMS; shares ahead 8% (Aug. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 PM | 28 Comments
  • CBS

    New expose puts Moonves' $120M CBS severance at risk

    • A new expose in The New York Times about misconduct allegations around former CBS chief Les Moonves could cost him the $120M severance on the line following his September exit from the company.
    • The story brings up a new report of sexual assault from 25 years ago and comment from a show business manager that Moonves last December discussed the possibility of getting the actress involved, Bobbie Phillips, a new acting gig to keep her happy.
    • “I think I’ll be O.K.,” Moonves said, according to a sworn statement by manager Marv Dauer. “But if Bobbie talks, I’m done.”
    • Word that Moonves was pushing for new work for Phillips was key to the board's decision that Moonves needed to be forced out of the job, according to the story.
    • CBS is down 1.6% after hours.
    • Previously: CBS erases losses on word it will test market after Moonves probe (Oct. 08 2018)
    • Previously: CBS gets subpoenas on Moonves, related matters (Sep. 28 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 7 Comments
  • NDLS

    Noodles & Co. -5.4% with secondary offering back on

    • Noodles & Co. (NASDAQ:NDLS) is 5.4% lower postmarket after Bloomberg reports a 5.6M-share block trade in the offing.
    • The shares are being shopped by a shareholder at $9.00-$9.10 each, Bloomberg says; shares closed today at $9.30, suggesting as much as a 3.2% discount.
    • Morgan Stanley is the underwriter.
    • Shares have slid 26.6% since the shareholders first announced plans to sell an 8.75M-share block on Oct. 24; that offering was punted a day later due to market conditions.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 6 Comments
  • I

    Intelsat -2.8% on 10M-share secondary offering

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) is down 2.8% after hours following the announcement of a secondary offering by selling shareholders.
    • The offering of 10M shares comes via Goldman Sachs and J.P. Morgan.
    • Underwriters have an option for an additional 1.5M common shares.
    • The company won't receive any proceeds from the offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 18 Comments
  • LZB

    VEEV, BOX and TLYS among notable after hour movers

    • Gainers: LZB +9.8%. CMCM +6.9%. VEEV +6.6%. STKL +3.9%. BOX +3.6%.
    • Losers: TLYS -10.2%. OTCQB:SNNVF -3.1%. BSAC -2.4%.RFP -2.2%. TRMB -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • JRJC

    More on China Finance Online fiscal Q3

    • China Finance Online (NASDAQ:JRJC) fiscal Q3 loss per ADS of 26 cents narrows from a loss of 37 cents a year ago, but widens from a 19-cent loss in Q2.
    • JRJC -1.6% in after-hours trading.
    • Q3 net revenue slips to $8.6M from $12.9M in Q2 and $10.7M in Q3 2017.
    • Gross margin increases to 58.2% from 44.9% a year ago.
    • Conference call 8:00 PM ET.
    • Previously: China Finance Online reports Q3 results (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • TRCO

    Tribune Media +6% as Apollo reportedly teams up on bid

    • Tribune Media (NYSE:TRCO) has jumped 6% in the late session after Reuters reports that Apollo (NYSE:APO) is teaming up with a broadcast partner, Northwest Broadcasting, in a bid to take Tribune over.
    • Tribune has been on the block since a failed attempt from Sinclair Broadcast Group (NASDAQ:SBGI).
    • Also in the ring: a team of ION Media with Cerberus and Tom Hicks, and Nexstar Media Group (NASDAQ:NXST), as well as Byron Allen.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • LMT

    Saudi Arabia takes big step toward $15B deal for Lockheed's THAAD system

    • Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) +2.3% after-hours following a CNBC report that Saudi Arabia has signed a letter of offer and acceptance with the U.S. for the company's THAAD missile defense system, a crucial step forward in the $15B deal.
    • Saudi officials reportedly signed the deal earlier this week, paving the way for the sale of 44 THAAD launchers, missiles and related equipment.
    • The news comes despite criticism of the Saudis over the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi; Pres. Trump has cited the importance of defense deals as a key factor in his decision to stick with the kingdom in the aftermath of the slaying.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 20 Comments
  • SMTC

    Semtech reports Q3 beats, in-line EPS guide

    • Semtech (NASDAQ:SMTC) reports Q3 beats with revenue up 16% Y/Y to $173.55M and EPS at $0.63.
    • Q3 guidance has revenue of $155M to $165M (consensus: $165.86M) and EPS of $0.53 to $0.57 (consensus: $0.56).
    • Key metrics: Gross margin, 61.7%; Operating margin, 30.4%; SG&A expense, $29.8M; R&D expense, $24.5M.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • DGX

    Quest Diagnostics down 2% after hours on guidance cut

    • Ahead of its Investor Day tomorrow, Quest Diagnostics (NYSE:DGX) announces key strategic objectives and updated 2018 guidance.
    • It plans to derive at least 2% of its compounded average annual growth (CAGR) through acquisitions.
    • Quarterly dividend increased to $0.53 per share (from $0.50).
    • 2018 outlook: Revenues: ~$7.57B from ~$7.62B; EPS: >$5.34 from $5.57 - 5.64; non-GAAP EPS (ex-depreciation): >$6.30 from $6.53 - 6.60; cash flow ops: ~$1.25B from ~$1.30B.
    • Shares are down 2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • GES

    Guess -8% after profit miss

    • Guess (NYSE:GES) fally sharply after investors seize on the company's Q3 profit miss.
    • Operating margin for the quarter was 2.2% of sales vs. 1.0% a year ago. Gains were recorded in the Americas wholesale and retail segments.
    • Looking ahead, Guess expects Q4 EPS of $0.69 to $0.76 vs. $0.75 consensus and revenue growth of 4% to 6%.
    • GES -8.5% AH to $20.02.
    • Previously: Guess misses by $0.03, beats on revenue (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • VEEV

    Veeva Systems +6.6% on Q3 beats, upside guide

    • Veeva Systems (NYSE:VEEV) gains 6.6% on Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with 27% Y/Y revenue growth. Upside Q4 guidance has revenue of $226M to $227M (consensus: $221.88M) and EPS at around $0.40 (consensus: $0.37). FY20 guidance has revenue at $1B compared to the $997.63 consensus.
    • Revenue breakdown: Subscription Services, $178.2M (consensus: $175.2M); Professional Services and Other, $46.5M (consensus: $40.5M).
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP operating margin, 37.6% (consensus: 34.6%); cash from operations, $41.6M; ending deferred revenue, $196.2M; billings, $161.7M (consensus: $150.2M).
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Veeva Systems beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • BOX

    Box +2.3% on Q3 beats, in-line guide

    • Box (NYSE:BOX) gains 2.3% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with revenue up 21% Y/Y. In-line Q4 guidance has revenue of $163.5M to $164.5M (consensus: $164.22M) and EPS of $0.02 to $0.03 (consensus: $0.02).
    • FY19 guidance has revenue of $608.2M to $609.2M and EPS of -$0.16 to -$0.15.
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP operating margin, -4.9% (consensus: -6.6%); cash from operations, $6.8M; ending deferred revenue, $301.2M; billings, $155.6M (consensus: $154.2M); paying customer base, grew to over 90K.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Box beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • DHI

    Homebuilders erase morning losses after Powell blinks

    • Homebuilder stocks erased morning losses after Fed Chair Jerome Powell said he sees the current benchmark interest rate range "just below" the neutral rate.
    • iShares U.S. Home Construction ETF ended the session up 2.7%, completely erasing an earlier decline of as much as 2.5% when October homes sales fell short of consensus to a three-year low.
    • Among individual homebuilders: D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) +2.8%, KB Home (NYSE:KBH) +1.4%, PulteGroup (NYSE:PHM) +1.3%, Toll Brothers (NYSE:TOL) +1.5%, Lennar (NYSE:LEN) +2.4%, and NVR (NYSE:NVR) +4.1%.
    • Previously: Markets - two more hikes, then done (Nov. 28)
    • Previously: Markets advance after Powell's `just-below' neutral remark (Nov. 28)
    • Previously: Homebuilders slide after soft new home sales print (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • ATO

    Atmos Energy to launch $650M public share offering

    • Atmos Energy (NYSE:ATO) -3.2% after-hours as it announces a planned public offering of $650M in common shares, including $150M in forward sale agreements, with an underwriters option to purchase up to $97.5M of additional shares.
    • ATO says it plans to use the proceeds, plus any proceeds received upon the settlement of the forward sale agreements, to repay short-term debt under its commercial paper program, to fund capital spending primarily to enhance the safety and reliability of its system and for general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • VEEV

    Veeva Systems beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Revenue of $224.73M (+27.0% Y/Y) beats by $8.68M.
    • Shares +5%.

  • MO

    Altria in talks for Juul stake - CNBC

    • Altria (MO +2.2%) jumps after CNBC reports that the company is in talks to take a significant minority stake in e-cig player Juul.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 91 Comments
  • NLSN

    Nielsen brings more data to Horizon Media

    • Nielsen (NYSE:NLSN) and Horizon Media deepen their partnership to include Nielsen's Digital Content Ratings data as part of Horizon's Cadence media planning and activation tool.
    • Horizon has integrated Nielsen's Total Media Fusion data into Cadence for several years.
    • Nielsen shares are up 1.3% to $26.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM

  • Crude oil -2.5% to YTD low on 10th straight week of rising U.S. stockpiles

    • Crude oil's brief bump following Fed Chair Powell's dovish interest rate remarks failed to hold up, as January WTI crude closed -2.5% to $50.29/bbl, the lowest settlement in nearly 14 months; Brent -2.4% to $58.76/bbl.
    • U.S. crude inventories rose for the 10th week in a row, jumping by a much larger than forecast 3.6M barrels to 450.5M barrels - the highest since Thanksgiving week in 2017 - even as U.S. refinery activity climbed three percentage points to a 96% utilization rate.
    • WTI has plunged 34% since hitting a multiyear high of $76.41/bbl a barrel in early October.
    • "Crude not being able to rally with risk-on [sentiment] across the board and U.S. dollar weakness in all asset classes says a lot," says Tariq Zahir of Tyche Capital Advisors, adding that "a break of $50 is inevitable" for WTI.
    • Brent crude failed to maintain an early boost from a supply outage in the North Sea.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, ERYY, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 24 Comments
  • ALPMF

    FDA OKs Astellas' gilteritinib for certain type of leukemia; shares up 2%

    • The FDA approves Astellas Pharma's (OTCPK:ALPMF) Xospata (gilteritinib) for the treatment of adult patients with relapsed/refractory FLT3 mutation-positive acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
    • FLT3+ AML represents about 25 - 30% of AML cases.
    • Shares are up 2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • PVAC

    Mangrove hikes Penn Virginia stake to 10.7%, seeks end to Denbury deal

    • Penn Virginia (PVAC +3.2%) is higher after Mangrove Partners raises its active stake to 10.7% from 9.5% and calls on the termination of Denbury Resources' (DNR +1.3%) cash and stock offer to acquire the company.
    • Otherwise, Mangrove says it will vote against the merger and to file its own proxy statement to solicit votes against the proposed deal.
    • Mangrove says it has moved all of its PVAC shares to a fully-paid position in order to secure its right to vote all of its shares once the company has set a record date.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 29 Comments
  • MU

    Micron +2.6% on CEO conference comments

    • Micron (NASDAQ:MU) gains 2.6% after CEO Sanjay Mehrotra speaks at the Credit Suisse Technology Conference.
    • The CEO expects NAND supply issues to improve in 2H and is "very pleased" with the progress on the US-China trade war and associated tariffs.
    • Mehrotra says revenues are tracking towards the lower end of  guidance while EPS is at the higher end of its outlook.
    • Sources: StreetAccount and Briefing.com.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 153 Comments
  • FTNW

    Technology movers and shakers

    • Gainers: FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) +25%. Cheetah Mobile (NYSE:CMCM) +20%. IEC Electronics (NYSEMKT:IEC) +17%. BrightView Holdings (NYSE:BV) +16%. Ooma (NYSE:OOMA) +14%.
    • Losers: SITO Mobile (NASDAQ:SITO) -9%. Lantronix (NASDAQ:LTRX) -8%. Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) -7%. GSE Systems (NYSEMKT:GVP) -6%. Image Sensing Systems (NASDAQ:ISNS) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • SJM

    J.M. Smucker falls to 2018 low

    • Shares of J.M. Smucker (NYSE:SJM) are down 7.65% and traded as low as $100.65 earlier in the session after the company's earnings report disappointed.
    • Leaning to the bullish side on the food stock, Susquehanna analyst Pabloz Zuanic observes that most of J.M. Smucker's EPS miss was due to a higher tax rate and notes the strong coffee EBIT delivered by the company during the quarter. "We continue to recommend the stock given the ongoing pivot to better growth and more premium products," writes Zuanic.
    • It's a different story over at the Credit Suiss desk as the firm sticks with an Underperform rating. "This quarter reinforced our concern that the company will need to make an even bigger investment than expected to return to sustainable growth," writes the CS analyst team. The firm notes SJM's organic revenue declined 1% in the quarter despite the launch of two heavily-marketing product platforms.
    • Previously: J. M. Smucker misses by $0.11, misses on revenue (Nov. 28)
    • Previously: J.M. Smucker lowers profit guidance (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 21 Comments
  • AR

    Natural gas jumps as cold air descends on U.S. Midwest

    • U.S. natural gas futures surged today as a burst of Arctic air descended on the Midwest, signaling that stockpiles may plunge in the coming weeks; Nymex nat gas +11.2% to $4.74/MMBtu.
    • Prices are heading for their best November in 18 years as an unusually cold start to the peak heating season stokes concern that supplies will be constrained during the winter; while production has jumped this year, surging demand has kept inventories well below normal.
    • Snow showers will continue downwind of the Great Lakes with frigid air remaining in place over next seven days, and it is also cold across the Southeast.
    • "Strong weather systems with snow, ice, and colder than normal temperatures will impact much of the country," during Dec. 5-10, says NatGasWeather.com.
    • "The market is hypersensitive to what cold represents," says Gene McGillia, senior analyst at Tradition Energy. "We have all of winter coming with such low storage levels. It's also expiration, so you probably have some thinness in the market, and the volatility we have in the market is still a dominant underlying theme."
    • Gas-focused equities are mostly higher: AR +2.3%, GPOR +2.3%, EQT +1.6%, COG +1.3%, SWN +1.3%, RRC flat, CHK -0.6%.
    • ETFs: UNG, UGAZ, DGAZ, BOIL, GASL, FCG, KOLD, UNL, GASX, DCNG, GAZB
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 95 Comments
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics bounces off yesterday's plunge as Trump tweets approval

    • Steel Dynamics (STLD +3%) bounces off a 14-month low after Pres. Trump congratulated the company for its plan to build a new steel mill in the U.S. and creating jobs.
    • "Steel jobs are coming back to America, just like I predicted. Congratulations to Steel Dynamics!"
    • STLD said after the close on Monday that it will invest $1.7B-$1.8B to build a new flat roll mill with a production capacity of 3M tons, creating 600 "well-paying" jobs with construction expected to begin in 2020 and operations seen starting in H2, prompting a 9% plunge in the shares.
    • Other steel names also are higher but less so: AKS +1.4%, NUE +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 6 Comments
  • HUM

    Big day for health insurers

    • Humana (HUM +5.9%) this morning announced an accelerated buyback program, the CVS/Aetna deal closed, and the bulls continue to laud UnitedHealth's (UNH +3.9%) forward guidance from Monday.
    • "Street enamored with UnitedHealth's decade-long outlook [is] an understatement," says Jefferies' Jared Holz.
    • Said decade-long outlook includes 13-16% annualized EPS growth, notes JPMorgan's Gary Taylor.
    • Other players: Anthem (ANTM +3.3%), Centene (CNC +2.9%), Molina (MOH +3.3%), WellCare (WCG +3.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 3 Comments

    Ferroglobe and NexGen Energy among Energy/Materials gainers; Superior Drilling Products and ZK International among losers

    | 2:00 PM
  • IQ

    Report: IQiyi eyeing convertible bonds for fund-raising

    • IQiyi (IQ -1.7%) is looking at a convertible bond sale to refill its coffers, Bloomberg reports.
    • The video streamer is weighing interest in an offering that could raise $500M-$1B, in a sale that would come as soon as this year, according to the report.
    • That would get it more funds for spending in a highly competitive online video sector just eight months after posting an IPO that ranked as the year's biggest Chinese share sale in the U.S.
    • Shares are about 10% over their IPO price but have lost more than half of market value from a June peak.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 32 Comments

    NanoSphere to sell 7.5M Units at $0.30

    • NanoSphere Health Sciences (OTC:NSHSF +3.2%) has agreed to sell 7.5M Units at $0.30 per Unit in a private transaction. Each Unit consists of one common share and one two-year warrant to purchase one common share at $0.50.

    eHealth leads financial gainers; Hennessy Advisors and Itau Unibanco among losers

    America Movil +3.7% as UBS bumps to Buy on lower risk

Atkore International Group (NYSE:ATKR) +18%.

  • Markets - two more hikes, then done

    • The Fed Funds rate is "just below" neutral, said Jay Powell minutes ago, significantly changing his stance from just weeks ago when he said rates were a "long way" from neutral.
    • The major averages, commodities, and overseas currencies are all on the rise, and expectations of future rates hikes are on the decline.
    • Checking 30-day Fed Funds futures, traders have priced in a pretty good chance of another rate hike in December, then just one more at some point in 2019 ... and that's it.
    • ETFs: IEF, SHY, PST, IEI, BIL, VGSH, VGIT, UST, DTYS, TYO, SHV, SCHO, GSY, SCHR, TBX, TYD, SPTS, ITE, DTYL, RISE, DTUS, DTUL, TUZ, GBIL
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 83 Comments
  • IP

    Containerboard stocks on watch amid IP presentation

    • The containerboard sector could react to comments made today by execs with International Paper (IP -1.5%) at the Citi Basic Materials Conference. The company pointed to lower pricing due to seasonal factors and the impact of higher interest rates on M&A potential.
    • Management also said IP is on track to achieve +15% EBITDA growth this year.
    • Sector watch: Greif (GEF), Packaging Corp of America (PKG +0.7%), Westrock (WRK +0.5%).
    • International Paper presentation slides
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 10 Comments
  • DTEGY

    European telecoms see boost from rare OK for Dutch merger

    • European telecoms are continuing a November ramp-up after an uncommon go-ahead from the European Commission for a mobile merger in the Netherlands.
    • Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY) and Tele2 (OTCPK:TLTZY) got approval to combine their operations which rank No. 3 and No. 4 in the country, a reversal from an antitrust watchdog that generally has put a kibosh on such combinations.
    • That move "breaks a pattern" and gives strength to the idea that such combos are considered on individual merits, Jefferies' Ulrich Rathe says, but urges caution on read-through to the broader industry. "Maybe the tiger has not changed its stripes after all," considering the deal just takes out an already weak Tele2 Dutch operation. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Meanwhile Goldman Sachs concurs about reading too much into the approval. Denmark's market is most similar to the Netherlands, and Orange (ORAN +0.2%) might benefit from French consolidation, it says. The firm estimates an annual 1-2 percentage-point boost to EBITDA growth for all operators in a market.
    • In U.S. trading: OTCQX:DTEGY -0.2%; OTCPK:KKPNY +1.6%; VOD +1.6%; LBTYA -0.7%; TEF +1.6%; BT +0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 1 Comment

  • Markets advance after Powell's `just-below' neutral remark

    • U.S. stock markets surge after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell takes a more dovish tone.
    • The Dow swings up 1.8% with the S&P 500 up 1.4% and the Nasdaq +1.9%.
    • Powell describes the central bank's current benchmark rate range as "just below" the neutral rate--the point at which the interest rate neither helps nor hinders the economy.
    • By contrast, in early October Powell said the Fed was "a long way" from neutral.
    • Today he says: "Interest rates are still low by historical standards, and they remain just below the broad range of estimates of the level that would be neutral for the economy,"  in his speech before the Economic Club of New York.
    • FOMC is forecasting "continued solid growth, low unemployment, and inflation near 2%."
    • And they're watching economic data carefully, he says. "We also know that the economic effects of our gradual rate increases are uncertain, and may take a year or more to be fully realized."
    • Though FOMC members base projections on best assessments of the outlook and says "there is no preset policy path," he said.
    • U.S. 10-year Treasury note yield slips less than 1 bp to 3.05%.
    • The U.S. Dollar Index falls 0.3% to 96.90.

    • W +8.50% premarket to $99.39.
